optionalFeatureTypes.TL:CotN: The Lord; Champion of the Night

items: You gain {@sense tremorsense} of 60 feet. (tremorsense doesn't not substitute sight for the purposes that require you to see a creature).

items.name: Walls Have Ears
entries: Using your action, you touch your ear on an adjacent wall. You feel the vibration of each creature talking in a 150 feet radius that is within 10 feet of a wall. The walls must have a physical path connecting them. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency bonus per long rest.

items: For a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus, you can concentrate on two spells instead of one. After the duration, the one that was first cast, expires.
While concentrating on two spells, the DC for saving throws to maintain concentration is 10 + the sum of spell slot levels used in the two spells, or half the damage taken, whichever is higher.
After the end of a long rest, you can temper a melee weapon to increase its damage by 1. Each individual weapon can be modified once.

Additionally, choose an amount of armor equal to your proficiency, you temper armor to have temporary protection. Each armor tempered gives to the wearer temporary hit points according to its type: Light: equal to the highest class level of the wearer. Medium: two times the highest class level of the wearer. Heavy: three times the highest class level of wearer. Each armor can be tempered once.
You gain proficiency in {@skill Survival}.
When facing a creature for the first time, you can make a {@skill Survival} check to find its mostly deadly, non-spell feature.
During the first round of combat, you have resistance to all damage.
Damage inflicted with the chosen weapons increases by 2.
Once per round, when holding one of those weapons and getting hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make an attack against your attacker.
Whenever you roll damage for a spell, you can reroll a number of damage equal to your spellcasting modifier. You must keep the new results.
Whenever you learn a new spell, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 20 you can learn an additional spell that meets the same requirements as the spell that triggered the roll.
You swap out one skill proficiency you had for expertise in two skills that you already are proficient with.
A number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus of your choice, have advantage on initiative rolls.

When another creature that you can see within 30 feet makes an opportunity attack, you can use your reaction to give them advantage and +5 on the damage. If the attack misses, you regain your reaction.
You gain proficiency in {@skill History} and {@skill Survival}. If you already are proficient, you gain expertise instead.
Once per round, when you hit with a bludgeoning melee weapon, you can deal extra damage equal to your Strength + Constitution modifier.
While you are below 50% of your max hp, allies within 30 feet of you have a +2 bonus on their saving throws.
While you are below 30% of your max hp, allies within 30 feet of you have their speed increased by 10 feet.
While you are below 10% of your max hp, allies within 30 feet of you can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action.
While you are below or at 0 hp, allies within 30 feet of you can move half their speed as a reaction.
When you die, each ally within 30 feet is affected by the {@spell bless} spell for {@dice 3d10} days. If you come back to life the effect ends.
When you spend one or more hours of uninterrupted talking with a single creature, you bestow them the following:
Temporary HP equal to your highest class level + your charisma modifier.
Advantage against {@condition frightened|fear} effects until the next day
Advantage on all attacks on the first round of each combat, until the next day.
Advantage on their first death saving throw, until the next day.
Advantage on the first initiative check, until the next day.
You have a +5 bonus on initiative rolls.
Standing up from prone costs you 5 feet of movement.
Your walking speed increases by 5.
Your melee weapon attacks gain +1 to the damage for each adjacent ally to you.
You can use 10 feet of movement to swap places with a willing, adjacent ally. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks for either of you.
Damage you take that is less than two times your Constitution modifier, cannot disrupt your concentration
Your natural way with words leaves everyone irritated. Creatures within 10 feet of you suffer a -3 penalty to attack rolls as long as their Intelligence is higher than 3 and they can understand you.

Your level of annoyance has become a taunting mechanism. Whenever an ally within 30 feet of you is targeted by a ranged attack or spell you can use your reaction to swap the targeting to yourself. If it's an AoE spell, you become the center. The attack must be able to see you and hear you and the attack/spell's limitations still apply.

Whenever you cast spell of 1st level or higher that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage a swirling aura of that element forms around you in 10 feet radius, until the start of your next turn  Enemies that enter or start their turn in the aura, take elemental damage of that type that equal to two times the spell slot level that was used.

foundryEffects.name: Shield Artist Adjacent Ally AC Bonus

items: When you hit with a one-handed melee weapon and your other hand is holding a shield, you can forgo half of your damage and get a bonus to AC equal to your Strength modifier until the start of your next turn.
At the end of your turn, if you haven't moved during that turn, an adjacent ally gets a +2 bonus to their AC as long as they are within 5 feet of you.
As a bonus action, you can swap the damage type of your next spell as following:
Radiant <> Necrotic
Fire <> Cold
Thunder <> Lightning
Acid <> Force
Poison <> Psychic
Whenever you damage a creature with a damage type that is vulnerable to, you gain temporary hit points equal to your highest class level.

When a non-abjuration spell that targets you and only you is cast, you can use your reaction to make an {@skill Arcana} check. If the {@skill Arcana} check is higher than 10 + the spell's level, you choose to negate either the damage or the rest of the spell's effects. If the {@skill Arcana} check is higher than 14 + the spell level, you negate both. If the {@skill Arcana} check is higher than 20 + the spell's level, you deflect the spell back to the caster.

otherSummary.entry: proficiency with at least 4 piercing weapons

foundryEffects.name: Twist the Blade Piercing Damage Bonus

items: Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon that deals piercing damage, the damage increases by an amount equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
While wielding a weapon with the Reach property, creatures provoke opportunity attacks when entering your reach instead of leaving.
Opportunity attacks deal 2 damage for each 5 feet the creature moved to enter your reach.

You can take the {@action Help} Action as a bonus action and the range becomes 30 feet. If the assisted character fails, you can spend your reaction to move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Whenever you spend a certain amount of gold within a settlement, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: 1000+ Gold
entries: The trader starts to remember you, is willing to share beneficial (but not secret) information, recommend you to other traders or reserve products or services for you.

items.name: 5000+ Gold
entries: Your name starts to become known amongst traders in that settlement. You start getting discounts or custom orders.

items.name: 10000+ Gold
entries: You have become a known wealthy individual. People are eager to be in your good side and are more keen on doing favors for you. Your opinion on social or economical matters is weighted heavily (unless you have a bad reputation for other reasons).

items.name: 25000+ Gold
entries: Traders will consider loaning gold to you and it's quite easy for you to purchase valuable real estate in the settlement. People are more than happy to work for you or be employed by you.

items.name: 100000+ Gold
entries: If there is opportunity for new leadership in the settlement, you are the most favorable candidate for every trader and simple citizen.

items: You gain proficiency in {@skill Religion}.
Pick a {@5etools deity|deities.html}. You acquire an amulet or emblem that proves your faith. Faithful of the same deity have no doubt you are one of them.
You can make a {@skill Religion} check in place of any other {@dice d20} roll. You can use this ability a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).
Once per day you can use Divine Smite at level 2 at no cost of spell slots (regardless whether you are Paladin or not).
As a bonus action, you gain hp equal to your {@skill Religion} bonus. (5 uses, recharge on long rest)
The times you can use Divine Smite per day equal to your {@skill Religion} bonus.
Creatures with beliefs opposite of your deity, have {@chance 15|15%} of being {@condition frightened} of you when they see you. The effect lasts for a day.
When damage would reduce you to 0 hp or lower, make a {@skill Religion} check. You gain that many temporary hit points before reducing your hp lower than 1.
All your attacks deal +3 radiant damage.
Saving throws against your spells that deal radiant damage have a -5 penalty.
At the start of your long rest, you may pose a question to your deity. During your rest, omens show as answers, or a cryptic dream.

choose.entry: Increase one ability score of your choice by 1. This increase allows your score to go over 20.

items: You can take this feat multiple times.
Once per long rest, you can reroll an attack roll, ability check or saving throw of a score that is higher than 20 (this effect does not stack)

When you have no spell slots left, you can attempt to cast a spell. Choose the level of spell slot (maximum 5th level) as normal, then roll a {@dice d100} and consult the following table. X is the spell slot level of the spell.
When you roll on the {@table Desperate Caster|NED} table, add 9 to the result. Treat any result above 100 as 100.
The maximum spell level increases from 5th to 7th.
If you spend {@dice 1d4} days in a settlement, you can determine a profitable way to make money in that area.
Each day you find dropped coins around the areas you pass. At the end of each day you find {@dice 1d12} x your level worth of gold pieces.

feat.name: Brothers in Arms

foundryEffects.name: Brothers in Arms Adjacent Attack Bonus
Brothers in Arms Flanking Attack Bonus

entries: {@b {@i IMPORTANT: This feature requires {@color two (or more) separate characters|ff0000} having it to function!}}

items: When adjacent to one of your brothers you gain +2 to your weapon attacks, and you can split any bludgeoning, piercing or slashing (magical or not) damage that you take between you and your brother.
If you're flanking a creature with one of your brothers, you gain +4 to your weapon attacks.
Decrease one random ability score by 3 and another one by 1. If it would decrease it to 0 or lower, randomize again until a higher one is picked.
You always pass your first two death saving throws.

otherSummary.entry: Access to spell slots of 3rd level or higher

items: When you cast a spell and you are adjacent to another spellcaster with this feat, you can use spell slots of the adjacent spell caster to fuel your spell (provided they are willing). If you do so, choose one of the following:
One of the two spellcasters, spends the appropriate level of spell slot for the spell. If it is a concentration spell, you must maintain it, and your spellcasting DC is taken into account.
Both spellcasters spend the appropriate (same) level of the spell. The spell then is upcasted 1 level higher. You choose which spellcasting DC is taken into account and who is concentrating on it.

table.name: Desperate Caster
rows: The spell misfires dangerously. You take X{@dice d10} psychic damage. The damage cannot be reduced in any way.
The spell fizzles and you are {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.
After the spell is cast, you drop {@condition unconscious} for X days.
After the spell is cast, you gain X levels of {@condition exhaustion}.
The spell's effectiveness is one quarter of its intended. (rounded down).
The spell's effectiveness is halved. (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: The Lord
entries: You have made a pact with an infamous vampire lord. Whether through direct confrontation, a blood letter or a bat messenger, a deal was offered and you took it. The powerful vampire has bestowed you a sliver of its dreadful powers to test your usefulness and potential. Other vampires or vampiric creatures recognize the bond that you share and either respect it, fear it or envy it. You might have not turned into a vampire but you're one step away, provided that your patron agrees with it as well. You and other children of the night serve under the Lord's patronage and secretly mingle with the mortals to further advance the Lord's ambitions. The prospects of immortality, supernatural abilities and the ticket to a new society excite you and push you forward in this pact.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Lord lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Mortals' Bane
entries: You learn the {@spell primal savagery|XGE} cantrip, which now always sharpens your teeth into fangs. You can cast it as a bonus action and it deals necrotic damage instead of acid. On successful hits, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level. If a successful hit kills a creature, you also gain temporary hp equal to the damage dealt.

As a reaction you can add your Charisma modifier to your AC when you are being attacked by a humanoid. You do so, before the results of the attack roll are known. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hypnotic Bite
entries: Once per day, you can cast {@spell suggestion} without expending a spell slot, at a creature you have bitten in the last 24h. On a failed saving throw, the creature feels compelled to pursue the course of action for the rest of its life or until you use this feature again. Other limitations or requirements of {@spell suggestion} apply normally.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: You've slowly become an apex predator at night. While you are not in bright light, you have advantage on {@skill Perception}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, {@skill Intimidation} and initiative checks. You can also smell blood up to 150 feet away.

subclassFeature.name: Champion of the Night
entries: You seek to strengthen your pact by forming a more direct contract with your Lord's champions. You get the benefits of the chosen champion.

spell.name: Blood Spear

m.text: blood from a dead creature that has been killed within 24 hours or from a willing creature which takes {@dice 3d8} damage. The blood is consumed by the spell

entries: You draw and shape the blood into a spear like no other. The blood solidifies in a dark crimson material. The Blood Spear is a simple melee weapon (as a spear) which you are proficient with. On a successful attack it deals {@damage 2d6} piercing + {@damage 2d8} necrotic + your spellcasting modifier damage. You regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. This weapon ignores resistances but not immunities.

If the Blood Spear leaves your hands for more than 6 seconds, it liquifies into blood again. The Blood Spear has the Thrown property of 60/120 range. If thrown, it accelerates rapidly and against a bloodied creature it can never have disadvantage. On a successful thrown hit the damage is Xd6 necrotic + 10 piercing, where X is your warlock level.

items.name: Flight
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor. You can only fly short distances.

items.name: I'm not a Horse!
entries: A creature mounting the Centaur has disadvantage on attacks and saving throws. The Centaur has -2 AC if mounted.

items.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you gain a level in your class, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you level up again.

items.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

items.name: Brutal Presence
entries: When hitting a bloodied creature with your horns, you have advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks against it until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Sea Elf Training
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item trident|phb|tridents} and {@item net|phb|nets}.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Aquan and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

items.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you gain a level in your class, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you level up again.

items.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you gain a level in your class, you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you level up again.

items.name: Blessing of Zeriax
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You take necrotic damage equal to your highest hit die. This damage cannot be reduced or prevented. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

items.name: Ability Score Info
entries: If you choose the option to increase two ability scores by two, you must also decrease your Dexterity, Constitution or Charisma score by 2.

entries.replace: additional benefit based on one of the following options
entries.with: additional benefit based on two of the following options

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Aquan and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

items.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character. Additionally, you can also speak, read, and write Druidic if you choose to only increase your Intelligence and Charisma ability scores instead of boosting all three.

items.name: Languages:
items.entry: Two of your choice between Elvish, Dwarvish, Gith, or Orc

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A {@item holy symbol|phb}, a prayer {@item book|phb}, 5 sticks of incense, vestments, a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Together as One
entries: People of the Eratus have learned that together they can face anything. Under Arzen's banner the empire is able to face even the worst enemies. Whenever you make a saving throw to resist an effect that would make you {@condition frightened} and you can see at least one more creature with the same background, you have a +2 bonus to those saving throws.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A {@item hunting trap|phb}, 5 {@item rations (1 day)|phb|rations}, {@item hempen rope (50 feet)|phb|50 ft of hempen rope} and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 10gp

entries.name: Feature: On the Move
entries: You have learnt to pack fast, travel efficiently and hide well from the monsters of this world. Whenever you are being followed or tracked you know how to leave false tracks behind and cause impediments to your pursuers.

items.name: Languages:
entries: One of your choice between the standard languages.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A set of {@item fine clothes|phb}, an elven tattoo, a {@item book|phb} of elven poetry, and a {@item pouch|phb|purse} containing 25 gp

entries.name: Feature: Forgotten Wisdom
entries: Those who live with the elves often are granted access to the Library. Lore from a world that has ended, has been saved and meticulously archived there. You have a +3 to {@skill History} checks to recall lore and if your check fails you have {@chance 50|50%} chance of knowing someone that might know more.

items.name: Languages:
entries: One of your choice between the standard languages.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A set of {@item fine clothes|phb}, an official identity document, a scroll of pedigree, and a {@item pouch|phb|purse} containing 15 gp

entries.name: Feature: Protector of the Land
entries: Your ancestors have gone to great lengths and fought countless battles to protect these lands from invading humanoids and monsters alike. You know the land and can use it to your benefit. You know the most advantageous positions for combat in the area and you have advantage on checks to find your way when in the wilds of Unified Caldar.

optionalfeature.name: Night Huntress
entries: When in contract with the Night Huntress, you gain the following benefits.

items: Your speed increases by 20.
You can cast {@spell hunter's mark} once per day without expending a spell slot. Your Eldritch Blast also triggers Hunter's Mark damage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Caller
entries: When in contract with the Blood Caller, you gain the following benefits.

items: Whenever a creature within 15 feet of you takes slashing or piercing damage, you can use your reaction to cast a spell that targets only that creature.
Whenever you reduce a creature to less than 50% hp with a spell, you gain resistance to all damage from that creature until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Crimson Lancer
entries: When in contract with the Crimson Lancer, you gain the following benefits.

items: You learn the {@spell blood spear|NED} spell.

Whenever you kill a creature with your {@spell blood spear|NED}, each creature of your choice within 60 feet, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you for 1 min. Those creatures can repeat the saving throws at the end of each of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Warrior
entries: When in contract with the Mist Warrior, you gain the following benefits.

items: If damage would reduce your hp to 0 or lower it reduces it to 1 instead and you automatically cast {@spell gaseous form} on yourself without expending a spell slot. You gain temporary hit points equal to two times your warlock level and they last until the spell ends. You regain the use of this feature after a long rest.
A shroud of mist surrounds you when the light transitions. While in dim light conditions you can use a bonus action to take the {@action Dodge} action.
